【55】：
[L]imited data is available on their effectiveness in preventing transmission of H1N1.
However, the use of a facemask or respirator is likely to be of most benefit if used as early as possible when exposed to an ill person and when the facemask or respirator is used consistently.
另：
https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/hcp/guidance-prevent-spread-chinese.html?CDC_AA_refVal=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.cdc.gov%2Fcoronavirus%2F2019-ncov%2Fguidance-prevent-spread-chinese.html

Thus, while respirator use outside of the workplace setting without training and fit testing is unlikely to provide the same level of protection for everyone as when all aspects of a respiratory program are followed, it does provide some health benefits to most healthy users24-25 and can be considered a potential option by public health officials for reducing personal exposure to particulate respiratory hazards.
https://blogs.cdc.gov/niosh-science-blog/2018/01/04/respirators-public-use/
